parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Akin to, related; subst: fellow countryman, kinsman. From sun and genos; a relative; by extension, a fellow countryman.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, subdue; pass: To be in danger of death, be dead to, be rid of, be parted from. From thanatos to kill.
